content: Nice article! At least you didn’t have to put up with “infinite crunch mode” as in some other companies. I used to work in gamedev for 7 years, as an “engine developer” (from 3d stuff, over memory and streaming optimizations to 3dsmax plugins, back in the days of the first Xbox and the Xbox 360) but I don’t think I’ll ever return. Small companies no longer write their own tech (Unity FTW), gameplay programming isn’t my passion, and I wouldn’t want to work in a “games factory” either. All the best with your indie projects!
